Entries.default: "I thought Huana didn't believe in personal property. Yet you've brought quite the assortment of... leather necklaces?"
"Ekera, just so! But not all of them go around my neck."
"In that case, perhaps you could remove them from my sleeping berth."
"Oh, it is no burden, my friend! You are free to borrow one."
"My friend, you hide your face in a book while the beauty of the Deadfire passes you by!"
"A readied mind will be far more useful the next time we face dragons, cultists, or fampyrs."
"You are ready to face death. What of life, I say?"
"If you've never experienced the pleasure in a good book, more's the pity."
"Tekēhu. Must you practice your chants so loudly?"
"Songs are for singing, my friend. If they bother you, I will find one more to your liking."
"Tekēhu, if you keep tugging on... that, I fear you'll pull it clean off."
"My tentacles enjoy a good tug! I try not to take them by surprise, after last time..."
"If my people would control my talent for their own ends.... ekera, I owe them nothing in return."
"I suppose you discovered all of that on your own, lounging in the bathhouse?"
"Ekera, where I do my best thinking without the babble of scholars to fill my head."
"It would be a shame to deprive the Huana of my talents. Ekera, I am a gift to my people."
"Came up with all that from the warm waters of the bathhouse, did you?"
"Not all of us clear our heads with a cold bath."
"Apologies, friend. One of my tentacles squirted ink onto your grimoire."
"That's what that is? I... rather wish you hadn't told me."
"It is a territorial gesture, not to be taken personally."
"How could you live your life here and know so little about the Gullet?"
"I might ask the same about your Leaden Key. We are both guilty of overlooking the obvious."
"That's why I've endeavored to learn."
"Learn, learn learn. You will be an old man by the time you make up your mind."
"You've been... pensive since the Gullet."
"I never guessed that anyone could be unhappy in Neketaka."
"I followed the Leaden Key for years before I learned of its excesses."
"Is there some Aedyran trick for purging guilt that the Huana have missed?"
"Some are fond of palm wine. But I don't recommend it."
"The guild is so desperate for strength that it turns to cruelty."
"That knowledge gives you a responsibility."
"To my people, the guild, the islands? It is a heavy weight, being Ngati's Chosen."
"That knowledge gives you power to change things."
"If my power is all that can save the Huana, then... I do not know, friend elf."
"You're fidgeting again."
"My head itches. It does that in the company of nosy elf librarians."
"You should learn to disguise your emotions. You're thinking about Ukaizo again."
"I have thought about Ukaizo all my life. It has always been a dream, but never on the horizon."
"In my experience, millennia-old secrets are rarely simple."
"Be careful. You may not like what you find."
"I meant nothing by it. You're... thinking about Ukaizo, aren't you?"
